Get Latest Financial Information and Ticker Symbol From Company Name(s)

Source: R/search_from_text.R
search_from_text.Rd

Get latest overall insights and ticker symbols associated with free texts, such as companies names. Several ticker symbols associated with various exchanges places could be returned, with , companies names, last price on the marketplace, sector/category (if available), etc.

Usage

search_from_text(texts, .verbose = F, exchange = NULL, quotetype = NULL)

Arguments

texts

character A character string or a list of character representing the text(s) to search for, e.g., company names.

.verbose

logical, default = FALSE If TRUE, messages are displayed, e.g., when invalid symbols are detected.

exchange

(optionnal) A character string representing the exchange place(s) to consider - exact match, e.g., 'STO' (Stockholm stock exchange). Default keep all results.

quotetype

(optionnal) A character string representing the type of entry to search for, e.g., a stock market ('ETF', 'EQUITY' or 'MUTUALFUND') or a major indice ('INDEX').

Value

A data frame with the following columns:

symbol

numeric - The ticker symbol associated with an entry.

exchange

character - .

shortname

character - .

quotetype

numeric - .

index

character - .

score

numeric - .

typedisp

character - .

longname

character - .

exchdisp

character - .

isyahoofinance

character - .

searched

character - .

Details

Return a data.frame with additionnal attributes:

n.currencies

integer - Number of unique currencies in the data.frame.

currencies

character - A vector of currency symbols in the data.frame (e.g., "BTC", "ETH", "USD").

exchange

character - A vector of exchange pairs (e.g., "BTC => USD"). If not applicable, NULL (no entry).

date

Date - The date when the data was retrieved, set using Sys.Date().

crypto

logical - TRUE if cryptocurrencies are present, otherwise FALSE.

References

Source : https://query2.finance.yahoo.com/v1/

Examples

oil <- search_from_text(texts = c("TOTAL", "SHELL", "BP"),  quotetype = "EQUITY")
#Get data on marketplace(s)
swedish <- search_from_text(c("SAAB", "VOLVO"),  exchange = c("STO", "PAR"))
